The goal of Strategic Information Technical Support (SITS) is to strengthen country capacity to collect, manage, analyze and use information to guide decision-making. The purpose of this mechanism is to consolidate various PEPFAR SI activities managed by USAID into a larger, more comprehensive mechanism that uses economies of scale to increase efficiency and effectiveness. SITS will be the main vehicle for the implementation of PEPFAR SI Pivot 2 - “Support robust monitoring and evaluation (M&E) systems at service delivery points and districts” and Pivot 3 - “Increase use of data for evidence-based planning and decision making at all levels” in USAID-supported districts. This mechanism will include the Health Management Information System (HMIS) and Health Facility Assessment (HFA) and will support districts to conduct annual community health surveys using Lot Quality Assessment Sampling (LQAS); performance evaluations to assess effectiveness of different approaches in achieving health outcomes; design and implementation of quasi-experimental impact evaluations using retrospective program data in areas such as PMTCT, TB/HIV, HIV/Family Planning (FP) integration and ART; assembly, collation and sharing of information collected through above methods with stakeholders in an effort to promote collaborative learning and adaptation; utilization of GIS mapping to provide visual demonstrations of disease burden, transmission hotspots, geographic areas hosting key populations and health service coverage gaps; and documentation of project modifications to targeting, coverage, identification and prioritization of focus sub-populations/geographic areas, performance targets, resource allocation or management approaches. USAID expects to award this mechanism in May 2015.
